intro: Macleania angulata, commonly known as the angular macleania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, white or pink flowers. It produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
